page.title: 06MONASTRY SHRINE ROOM
page.content: The most important place in the Samye Ling Tibetan centre is the {Shrine {room}.Before entering this room shoes are all ways removed. The room is brilliantly lit and richly carpeted , with vivid decor . A gilt throne draped with priceless red and old brocade is placed beside the shrine itself , a kind of alter surrounded by gilt Buddhas , and carrying silver bowls of water and dishes of rice to symbolise offerings. Displayed around are many images of Buddha of which one thousand are being made for the new Temple which is under construction. It is here that{Puja },a ritual form of worship ,takes place ,conducted by a lama.Worshippers prostrate themselves and a Japanese drum beats softly.the chanting begins,prayer beads are fingered , and mantras are recited.
